text:
<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Elevated Error Rates for S3 Management Console>
We are currently experiencing intermittent errors accessing the AWS Management Console. AWS services are operating normally.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased Error Rates>
We are currently experiencing intermittent errors accessing the AWS Management Console when using account login credentials. The underlying AWS services and console logins using IAM users are operating normally.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Informational message: Increased Error Rates>
We have identified the root cause for the intermittent errors accessing the AWS Management Console when using root account login credentials. We are beginning to see recovery, and continue to work toward full resolution. The underlying AWS services and console logins using IAM users continue to operate normally.

<http://status.aws.amazon.com/|Service is operating normally: [RESOLVED] Increased Error Rates>
Between 12:28 PM and 3:13 PM PDT we experienced intermittent errors accessing the AWS Management Console. AWS services were not affected by this event. This issue has been resolved and the service is operating normally.
